meanings.definition: The basic monetary unit of several countries in the Middle East and North Africa.
meanings.sent1: In some countries, people use dinars to buy things like food and clothes.
meanings.sent2: I exchanged my dollars for dinars when I visited Jordan.
meanings.sent3: The dinars in my pocket jingled like tiny bells as I walked.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was worth more than a thousand dinars.
meanings.sent5: The golden dinars sparkled in the sunlight, a symbol of wealth and power.

meanings.definition: A unit of currency in various countries, including Algeria, Iraq, Jordan, and Tunisia.
meanings.sent1: The shopkeeper quoted the price in dinars, the local currency.
meanings.sent2: I need to exchange my euros for dinars before I can shop here.
meanings.sent3: The magician pulled a rabbit out of his hat, and it was holding a bag full of dinars!
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like a shower of golden dinars, spreading joy all around.
meanings.sent5: The sound of dinars clinking together was music to his ears, a sign of prosperity.
